html.p: A Neo4j(r) connector for Splunk(r) (using Cypher)
Persist your Splunk data into Neo4j graphs, query your Neo4j data from Splunk and execute custom cypher commands from Splunk SPL. All work on Neo4j is done via Cypher using the Neo4j Python driver.
Please refer to GRAPH-E on Github for further information.
Configure everything on the configuration page to get this app ready.

ol.li: Point the app towards your Neo4j instance(s) via the configuration page "Neo4j URIs". You may want to use "bolt+ssc://" as URI scheme if your Neo4j instance uses self-signed certificates. See Neo4j URI schemes for further information.
Enter your Neo4j Accounts to login to your Neo4j instance(s) via the configuration page "Neo4j Accounts". (The default account name after installation of Neo4j is usually "neo4j".)
You can configure multiple URIs and Accounts. The specific URI and account to be used by a custom commands can be set as input parameter.
